title: Superoscillations in the hypercomplex setting
authors: F. Colombo, F. Mantovani, S. Pinton, P. Schlosser
abstract:
Superoscillatory functions represent a counterintuitive phenomenon in physics
but also in mathematics, where a band-limited function oscillates faster than
its highest Fourier component. They appear in various contexts, including
quantum mechanics, as a result of a weak measurement introduced by Y. Aharonov
and collaborators. These functions can be extended to the complex variable and
are a specific instance of the more general notion of supershift. The aim of
this paper is to extend the notion of superoscillatory functions to the
hypercomplex setting. This extension is richer than the complex case since the
Fueter-Sce extension theorem for Clifford-valued functions provides two notions
of hyperholomorphic functions. We will explore these notions and address the
corresponding superoscillating theories.
